Headline: If you can't wait for Amazon shipping, shop these other online retailers
Article_Body: We've interviewed experts and found the best options to help you cope during this uncertain time. Find all of our coronavirus-related coverage here, and let us know your thoughts here. In an effort to meet the skyrocketing demand for social distancing supplies, Amazon is only restocking essential goods in its warehouses through at least April 5. Some customers hoping to take advantage of convenient Prime shipping can expect to wait up to a month for many items, meaning it's time to diversify your online shopping habits.  To help, we've rounded up a long list of stores to fill the Amazon-shaped hole in your heart. Though many of the retailers below have shuttered their physical locations, all are still fulfilling online orders at this time and can deliver essential and nonessential goods alike. Most big box stores like Target, Walmart, Bed Bath & Beyond, and Overstock are still up and running online, and offer a huge variety of products in the categories below.  The unfortunate truth is that pretty much all retailers are experiencing some shipping delays due to the pandemic, but you will still get what you need delivered within a few days.  But if you have a favorite clothing, game, or homegoods shop nearby, this is a great time to check if it's completing online orders; many small stores are waiving or reducing shipping fees in the wake of social distancing, and you'll be supporting your local economy. Without further ado, here are stores to supplement your Amazon shopping in the coming weeks.   Home decor   Overstock You can still shop Overstock's huge selection of furniture and home goods, including rugs, pillows, curtains and more. Plus, shipping is free on everything sitewide.    Wayfair Wayfair is continuing to offer free shipping on orders over $49 and has increased cleaning frequency across its facilities.   World Market World Market is still delivering its eclectic inventory of pillows, rugs, knickknacks, lamps and other decor items.   MOMA Design Store New York's Museum of Modern Art may be closed, but its beloved design store is still taking online orders.   Article Article is shipping its modern designs out as usual, though the company has switched over to totally contactless delivery (meaning there are no in-room assembly services).   At Home The superstore is continuing to deliver as usual.   Target Target has a famously huge and affordable home decor section. In addition to continued shipping, it's offering drive-up options for goods purchased online to be brought to your car.   CB2 Crate & Barrel's hip younger brother will continue to offer in-home furniture delivery and has taken added precautions when it comes to sanitizing its facilities.   West Elm West Elm will still deliver its midcentury modern decor to your home despite physical store closures.   Anthropologie Shop a gorgeous (though pricey) collection of unique decor, now with a longer 60-day return period and free mail-in returns.   Urban Outfitters UO has a large selection of chic and (slightly more) affordable decor that we promise won't make your home look like a dorm room.   Serena & Lily Serena & Lily is fulfilling orders as usual, and it's also offering the option to postpone delivery for 30 days free of charge for items eligible for white glove service.   H&M H&M has a very chic, affordable home section, and is offering free returns on everything and free shipping on orders over $25.     Tools and home improvement   Home Depot Home Depot is still open for in-person shopping with reduced hours and delivery. The company is also prioritizing frequent restocking of cleaning supplies.   Lowe's Lowe's is also continuing to deliver home supplies and keeping physical stores open with reduced hours in order to clean the store.   Sears Sears has a large tool section and is shipping as usual.   Acme Tools Acme Tools is still touting next-day shipping, free for orders over $199.   Tool Barn Tool Barn is an online-only retailer with a huge selection of products. Snag free shipping on most orders over $199.   Harbor Freight Harbor Freight stores are opening with limited hours and offering online shopping.   Tool Nut Tool Nut offers free shipping on orders over $99, and a flat-rate shipping fee of $8 on all other orders.   Grainger Physical stores remain open and shipping across the country. Curbside pickup is also available.   Northern Tool + Equipment Stores remain open with limited hours, and delivery and curbside pickup are available as well.    Household products   The Container Store Plenty of containers, plus cleaning supplies, storage options and other household goods are available online.   Ikea Low-cost furniture, bedding, decor and supplies are all still being sold online.   Again, department and big box stores like Costco, Walmart, Target, Overstock, Wayfair and Macy's have huge selections of household products and are delivering as quickly as possible.   Appliances   Home Depot Both Home Depot and Lowe's have large selections of large and small appliances.   Appliances Connection The store is still doing online orders, though demand and New York's mandatory shelter-in-place order may delay ship times.   Costco Costco is still including free basic hookups and haul-aways with its appliance deliveries.   Sears Sears is still shipping its huge range of refrigerators, dishwashers, ovens and more.   Best Buy Best Buy is offering doorstep delivery, curbside pickup, as well as drive-up pickup (meaning the goods will be brought to your car).   Staples Staples sells toasters, refrigerators, dishwashers, microwaves and other appliances in addition to office supplies, and is offering free delivery with no shipping minimum.   Macy's Macy's sells appliances both large and small and is offering free shipping on all orders over $25.   Electronics   Best Buy Best Buy, of course, also has a huge selection of home electronics.   Newegg Newegg is still shipping everything from webcams to massage chairs.   Costco Costco sells pretty much everything, including TVs, computers, tablets and speakers.   B&H Photo Video  The B&H NYC retail location along with its online store will be closed April 7 to April 17. After that the electronic superstore will only be accepting online orders.    GameStop The video game superstore also has a healthy selection of monitors, media players and other electronics.   Fishpond Fishpond lists thousands of electronics for sale on its website (in addition to products in just about every category on this list). Clothing and apparel   Most department stores are still fulfilling orders, as are many smaller boutiques. Check with your favorite indie designers to see if you can place an order online.   Zappos Shipping times may be longer than Zappos' typical lightning-fast turnaround, but you'll still get your goods.   Nordstrom Nordstrom is still shipping online orders but has shut down all retail stores in the U.S. and Canada, which means no curbside pickup for the time being.   Clad & Cloth Shop this trendy women's online boutique offering free shipping on orders of $75 or more and "easy returns" within 30 days of purchase. Asos The popular site claims things are "business as usual" while "working hard to make deliveries as safe as possible." It has also extended the return period to 90 days.    Revolve Revolve offers tons of designer and mid-range pieces, always with free shipping and returns.   Shopbop Shopbop has thousands of name-brand shoes, coats, clothes and accessories, often with two-day shipping.   Lulus Lulus' affordable and very on-trend women's clothing is shipping as usual.   Article& The hip boutique offers free shipping on all US orders.   Shoes.com Hundreds of name-brand shoes for adults and kids alike, with free shipping on all orders.   Walmart, Kohl's, JCPenney, Target and Gap et al. (Old Navy, Banana Republic, Athleta, etc.) all have affordable selections of clothes and shoes on their websites.     Sporting goods   REI REI is offering free standard shipping on all online orders, even as its physical stores remain closed through March 27. Dick's Sporting Goods Dick's is offering free shipping on orders over $25, plus the option of contactless curbside pickup. Backcountry Backcountry is continuing to ship its large selection of outdoor gear and clothing. Moosejaw Moosejaw is still offering free two-day shipping on orders over $49. Cabela's Spend $50 and get free two-day shipping. Bass Pro Shops As with Cabela's, Bass Pro Shops is offering free two-day FedEx delivery on orders over $50. Pet supplies Chewy.com Chewy has a huge selection of pet products and excellent customer service. Shipping is free on orders over $49, though Chewy warns that delivery times are longer than the usual one- to two-day timeframe due to increased demand. Petco Petco is still touting free one- or two-day shipping on orders over $35. PetSmart Grooming salons are closed, but PetSmart is still shipping all the supplies for your pet. Plus, it's offering curbside pickup with updated store hours.   1-800-PetMeds Its supply isn't as extensive as the three sites above, but 1-800-PetMeds is still offering free two-day shipping on orders over $49.   Pet Mountain Pet Mountain offers free shipping on orders over $49, as well as a selection of bulk deals.   Lots of home stores also have surprisingly robust dedicated pet sections. Try your luck at Target, Walmart, Overstock, and Kohl's (even though Kohl's physical stores are closed for now). Fresh food delivery services like NomNomNow and The Farmer's Dog are also still delivering as usual with no anticipated service disruptions.     Baby products   Buy Buy Baby Buy Buy Baby is still offering same-day delivery on many items and curbside pickup available at all stores.    Baby List Another option for registering or buying one-off baby products from a large inventory.   The Honest Company Subscribe for diaper and wipe deliveries and get 17% off every month.   Burt's Bees Baby The company offers free shipping this whole week, plus an extended, 60-day return period.   Bed Bath & Beyond Physical stores are closed, but the company continues to restock items online as quickly as possible and has also upped its return policy to 240 days.   Target, Walmart, Macy's, and other big box stores have well-stocked baby sections as well.     Beauty products   Ulta Ulta offers a huge range of beauty products, from drugstore to high-end, and is still offering free shipping on orders over $35.   Sephora Retail stores are shuttered through April 3, but you can still shop online (and get fully sealed free samples with your order). Plus you can get free shipping on every order until May 1 with code FREESHIP.   Dermstore Dermstore is still shipping orders and has bumped up its return window to 90 days.   Soko Glam Shop a wide selection of K-beauty supplies with free shipping on orders over $35 and a free gift with orders ove
